dfischer.utils

Class ApicaPMANetCmd

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.ApicaPMANetCmd

  • public class ApicaPMANetCmd
extends java.lang.Object
    Open a network connection to an Apica Performance Monitoring Agent Controller (PMA) and get 'measuring data' or 'metadata about measuring data' from the PMA.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ApicaPMANetCmd(ApicaPMANetConfig pmaNetConfig, java.lang.String clientIpAddress)
      Create a new instance to get data of an Apica Performance Monitoring Agent (PMA).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ApicaPMADirectory getPMADirectory()
      Get the directory (metadata) of an Apica Performance Monitoring Agent Controller (PMA).
      long getPMASystemTime()
      Get the OS system time of an Apica Performance Monitoring Agent Controller (PMA).
      ApicaPMAMeasuredDataCollection getPMAValues(ApicaPMANetCmdValuesRequest valuesRequest, ApicaPMAMonitoringTemplate pmaTemplate, boolean adjustSystemTimeDelta)
      Get measurement data from an Apica Performance Monitoring Agent Controller (PMA).
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Internal test program.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ApicaPMANetCmd

        public ApicaPMANetCmd(ApicaPMANetConfig pmaNetConfig,
              java.lang.String clientIpAddress)
        Create a new instance to get data of an Apica Performance Monitoring Agent (PMA).
        Parameters:
        pmaNetConfig - configuration data about the network connection to a Apica Performance Monitoring Agent Controller (PMA)
        clientIpAddress - the client IP address to use for the outbound connection, or pass a value of null if no specific client IP address is used (normal case).

    • Method Detail

      • getPMASystemTime

        public long getPMASystemTime()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the OS system time of an Apica Performance Monitoring Agent Controller (PMA).
        Returns:
        the OS system time (elapsed milliseconds since January 1, 1970, UTC);
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getPMADirectory

        public ApicaPMADirectory getPMADirectory()
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the directory (metadata) of an Apica Performance Monitoring Agent Controller (PMA).
        Returns:
        the directory (metadata)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getPMAValues

        public ApicaPMAMeasuredDataCollection getPMAValues(ApicaPMANetCmdValuesRequest valuesRequest,
                                          ApicaPMAMonitoringTemplate pmaTemplate,
                                          boolean adjustSystemTimeDelta)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Get measurement data from an Apica Performance Monitoring Agent Controller (PMA).
        Parameters:
        valuesRequest - a requisition for getting measurement data
        pmaTemplate - optional - can be null, the template for getting the measurement data
        adjustSystemTimeDelta - if true = adjust the OS system time between this local machine and the PMA controller
        Returns:
        A collection of ApicaPMAMeasuredDataSet(s), received from the Apica Performance Monitoring Agent Controller
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Internal test program.
